value.name: Juneteenth Kickoff Rally and the ongoing fight for justice for Black San Franciscans
value.description: Juneteenth is it a celebration? Or is it a continuous fight for our freedom? Are we really free? Wealth and Disparities in the Black Community, founded by Phelicia Jones, will be hosting a Juneteenth Kickoff Rally to be held on the front steps of San Francisco City Hall on June 17,

value.name: Some Advocates Say SFPD Has Made Progress on Reforms, But Not Enough
value.description: Since George Floyd's death a year ago, local residents might be wondering what type of law enforcement changes have happened here in the Bay Area.

video.name: Some Advocates Say SFPD Has Made Progress on Reforms, But Not Enough

value.name: SF Supervisors have failed to act on SFPD failure to complete DOJ COPS by California DOJ deadline
value.description: The SF BOS and SFPD will be scrutinized at a hearing on May 25, 2021 to expose the lack of attention in the past 5 years to the DOJ mandate of 2016, as the SFPD continues its relentless racist reign of terror on Black San Franciscans.

value.name: ‘I am deeply sorry’: SF police chief apologizes for non-fatal police shooting in unprecedented move
value.description: To be sure, Scott has made public apologies — notably to the family of Mario Woods, whom five officers shot and killed in December, 2015. “If we mess up, we need to say we’re sorry … we’ll fix it,” he said during a March, 2017, town hall.

value.name: Lesbian longtime police commissioner DeJesus steps down
value.description: She has "no plans for anything next, just going to take a breather." DeJesus said her proudest moment on the commission came in response to police officers fatally shooting Mario Woods in 2015, which led to an update of the San Francisco Police Department ...

value.name: W. Kamau Bell: What you need to know about 'defund the police'
value.description: In San Francisco, police have killed Black and Latinx people for reasons I would define as not good -- like the 2015 shooting of Mario Woods, and the 2014 shooting of Alex Nieto. In 2009 ...

value.name: De-escalation mandatory in California but training varies across police departments
value.description: The training instills the San Francisco Police Department’s de-escalation policy that was established in 2016 following the police killing of Mario Woods in the city’s Bayview. Three years ...

value.name: 110 Black Men And Boys Killed By Police
value.description: San Francisco police reportedly fired more than 20 gunshots at Mario Woods, who cops suspected of a stabbing, during a stand-off on Dec. 2, 2015 that underscored the SFPD’s documented history of ...
